summary: This document is an email chain from June 2019 between federal prosecutors and a victim witness coordinator discussing preparations for the imminent federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York. It focuses on victim notification procedures, coordination with the FBI, and concerns about complying with victims' rights obligations given the prior failures in the Florida case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The billionaire under investigation for paying dozens of minor girls to engage in sex acts with him at his Manhattan mansion; expected to be charged imminently.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Part of the FBI C-20 squad working on the Epstein investigation in New York.

persons.name: NYPD Detective
persons.context: NYPD Detective serving as an FBI Task Force Officer (TFO) on the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Victim Witness Coordinator
persons.context: The primary recipient/author of several emails, coordinating victim notification procedures and database entry for the upcoming Epstein prosecution.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) leading the case team, discussing investigation details and victim coordination.

connections.description: Coordinating victim notification procedures and compliance with victims' rights obligations for the upcoming Epstein prosecution.
Both are part of the FBI investigation team (C-20 squad) working on the Epstein case.
The prosecutor's office is coordinating with the FBI agents on the investigation and victim notification logistics.

events.title: Email Coordination on Epstein Prosecution
events.description: Email chain discussing final preparations for charging Jeffrey Epstein, focusing on victim notification and database coordination.

events.title: Daily News Article on Florida Case
events.description: A Daily News article is published about the Florida case, with victims stating they want their time in court.

events.title: Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Prior investigation in Florida where Epstein was granted a non-prosecution agreement, and the U.S. Attorney's Office was found to have violated victims' rights.

events.title: Expected Arrest and Charges in New York
events.description: The SDNY team expects to charge Jeffrey Epstein in the next week or so for conduct in New York, with an arrest to follow.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York was actively preparing to charge Jeffrey Epstein in late June 2019 for sex crimes involving dozens of minor girls in New York.
Prosecutors expressed concern about complying with victims' rights obligations due to the prior U.S. Attorney's Office in Florida being found to have violated those rights.
The investigation team had already spoken with four victims directly and planned to reach out to additional victims, including those involved in the Florida court case.
Coordination involved ensuring victims were entered into the FBI database and planning for victim notification at the time of Epstein's arrest.
The communication reveals the covert and confidential nature of the investigation just before it became public and high-profile.
